availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Oscar Anthony DeLeuw (Carlinville, Illinois, 121st US Colored troops 1st lieut & ass't adj gen'l)

body.p: Carlinville, Illinois, soldier. Sheboygan, Wisconsin native. Son of Leopold DeLeuw and Johanna L. DeLeuw. Attended school in Madison County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 122nd Illinois Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from February 19, 1864. Served in the 33rd Illinois Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.). Served in the 121st United States Colored Infantry Regiment as first lieutenant and assistant adjutant general from March 18, 1865, to October 4, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Wisconsin, Milwaukee County, Milwaukee, Ward 5, p. 398B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Madison County, Alton, p. 73.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Morgan County, Jacksonville, Ward 3, p. 16.
Illinois Civil War Muster and Descriptive Rolls Detail Report, Illinois State Archives, https://www.ilsos.gov/isaveterans/civilMusterSearch.do (accessed December 14, 2018).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served the United States Colored Troops: 56th-138th USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA Roll RG94-USCT-121-Bx06.
